022package com.restfb;
023
024import static com.restfb.logging.RestFBLogger.MAPPER_LOGGER;
025import static com.restfb.util.ObjectUtil.isEmptyCollectionOrMap;
026import static com.restfb.util.ReflectionUtils.*;
027import static com.restfb.util.StringUtils.isBlank;
028import static com.restfb.util.StringUtils.trimToEmpty;
029import static java.lang.String.format;
030import static java.util.Collections.unmodifiableList;
031import static java.util.Collections.unmodifiableSet;
032
033import java.lang.reflect.Field;
034import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
035import java.lang.reflect.Method;
036import java.math.BigDecimal;
037import java.math.BigInteger;
038import java.util.*;
039import java.util.Map.Entry;
040import java.util.stream.Collectors;
041
042import com.restfb.exception.FacebookJsonMappingException;
043import com.restfb.json.*;
044import com.restfb.types.AbstractFacebookType;
045import com.restfb.types.Comments;
046import com.restfb.util.DateUtils;
047import com.restfb.util.ObjectUtil;
048import com.restfb.util.ReflectionUtils;
049import com.restfb.util.StringJsonUtils;
050
051/**
052 * Default implementation of a JSON-to-Java mapper.
053 * 
054 * @author <a href="http://restfb.com">Mark Allen</a>
055 */
056public class DefaultJsonMapper implements JsonMapper {
057
058  private FacebookClient facebookClient;
059
060  /**
061   * Helper to convert {@link JsonValue} into a given type
062   */
063  private final JsonHelper jsonHelper;
064
065  /**
066   * Creates a JSON mapper which will throw {@link com.restfb.exception.FacebookJsonMappingException} whenever an error
067   * occurs when mapping JSON data to Java objects.
068   */
069  public DefaultJsonMapper() {
070    jsonHelper = new JsonHelper();
071  }
072
073  @Override
074  public void setFacebookClient(FacebookClient facebookClient) {
075    this.facebookClient = facebookClient;
076  }
077
078  @Override
079  public <T> List<T> toJavaList(String json, Class<T> type) {
080    ObjectUtil.requireNotNull(type,
081      () -> new FacebookJsonMappingException("You must specify the Java type to map to."));
082    json = trimToEmpty(json);
083
084    checkJsonNotBlank(json);
085
086    if (StringJsonUtils.isObject(json)) {
087      // Sometimes Facebook returns the empty object {} when it really should be
088      // returning an empty list [] (example: do an FQL query for a user's
089      // affiliations - it's a list except when there are none, then it turns
090      // into an object). Check for that special case here.
091      if (StringJsonUtils.isEmptyObject(json)) {
092        MAPPER_LOGGER
093          .trace("Encountered \\{} when we should've seen []. Mapping the \\{} as an empty list and moving on...");
094
095        return new ArrayList<>();
096      }
097
098      // Special case: if the only element of this object is an array called
099      // "data", then treat it as a list. The Graph API uses this convention for
100      // connections and in a few other places, e.g. comments on the Post
101      // object.
102      // Doing this simplifies mapping, so we don't have to worry about having a
103      // little placeholder object that only has a "data" value.
104      try {
105        JsonObject jsonObject = Json.parse(json).asObject();
106        List<String> fieldNames = jsonObject.names();
107
108        if (!fieldNames.isEmpty()) {
109          boolean hasSingleDataProperty = fieldNames.size() == 1;
110          Object jsonDataObject = jsonObject.get(fieldNames.get(0));
111
112          checkObjectIsMappedAsList(json, hasSingleDataProperty, jsonDataObject);
113
114          json = jsonDataObject.toString();
115        }
116      } catch (ParseException e) {
117        // Should never get here, but just in case...
118        throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("Unable to convert Facebook response JSON to a list of " + type.getName()
119            + " instances.  Offending JSON is '" + json + "'.",
120          e);
121      }
122    }
123
124    try {
125      JsonArray jsonArray = Json.parse(json).asArray();
126      List<T> list = new ArrayList<>(jsonArray.size());
127      for (JsonValue jsonValue : jsonArray) {
128        String innerJson = jsonHelper.getStringFrom(jsonValue);
129        innerJson = convertArrayToStringIfNecessary(jsonValue, innerJson);
130        list.add(toJavaObject(innerJson, type));
131      }
132      return unmodifiableList(list);
133    } catch (FacebookJsonMappingException e) {
134      throw e;
135    } catch (Exception e) {
136      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(
137        "Unable to convert Facebook response JSON to a list of " + type.getName() + " instances", e);
138    }
139  }
140
141  private String convertArrayToStringIfNecessary(JsonValue jsonValue, String innerJson) {
142    // the inner JSON starts with square brackets but the parser don't think this is a JSON array
143    // so we think the parser is right and add quotes around the string
144    // solves Issue #719
145    if (jsonValue.isString() && innerJson.startsWith("[")) {
146      innerJson = '"' + innerJson + '"';
147    }
148    return innerJson;
149  }
150
151  private void checkObjectIsMappedAsList(String json, boolean hasSingleDataProperty, Object jsonDataObject) {
152    if (!hasSingleDataProperty && !(jsonDataObject instanceof JsonArray)) {
153      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(
154        "JSON is an object but is being mapped as a list instead. Offending JSON is '" + json + "'.");
155    }
156  }
157
158  @Override
159  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
160  public <T> T toJavaObject(String json, Class<T> type) {
161    if (StringJsonUtils.isEmptyList(json)) {
162      return toJavaObject(StringJsonUtils.EMPTY_OBJECT, type);
163    }
164
165    checkJsonNotBlank(json);
166    checkJsonNotList(json);
167
168    try {
169      // Are we asked to map to JsonObject? If so, short-circuit right away.
170      if (type.equals(JsonObject.class)) {
171        return (T) Json.parse(json).asObject();
172      }
173
174      List<FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook>> listOfFieldsWithAnnotation = findFieldsWithAnnotation(type, Facebook.class);
175      Set<String> facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings =
176          facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings(listOfFieldsWithAnnotation);
177
178      // If there are no annotated fields, assume we're mapping to a built-in
179      // type. If this is actually the empty object, just return a new instance
180      // of the corresponding Java type.
181      if (listOfFieldsWithAnnotation.isEmpty()) {
182        if (StringJsonUtils.isEmptyObject(json)) {
183          T instance = createInstance(type);
184
185          // If there are any methods annotated with @JsonMappingCompleted,
186          // invoke them.
187          invokeJsonMappingCompletedMethods(instance);
188
189          return instance;
190        } else {
191          return toPrimitiveJavaType(json, type);
192        }
193      }
194
195      // Facebook will sometimes return the string "null".
196      // Check for that and bail early if we find it.
197      if (StringJsonUtils.isNull(json)) {
198        return null;
199      }
200
201      // Facebook will sometimes return the string "false" to mean null.
202      // Check for that and bail early if we find it.
203      if (StringJsonUtils.isFalse(json)) {
204        MAPPER_LOGGER.debug("Encountered 'false' from Facebook when trying to map to {} - mapping null instead.",
205          type.getSimpleName());
206        return null;
207      }
208
209      JsonValue jsonValue = Json.parse(json);
210      T instance = createInstance(type);
211
212      if (instance instanceof JsonObject) {
213        return (T) jsonValue.asObject();
214      }
215
216      if (!jsonValue.isObject()) {
217        return null;
218      }
219
220      JsonObject jsonObject = jsonValue.asObject();
221
222      handleAbstractFacebookType(json, instance);
223
224      // For each Facebook-annotated field on the current Java object, pull data
225      // out of the JSON object and put it in the Java object
226      for (FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation : listOfFieldsWithAnnotation) {
227        String facebookFieldName = getFacebookFieldName(fieldWithAnnotation);
228
229        if (!jsonObject.contains(facebookFieldName)
230            && !fieldWithAnnotation.getField().getType().equals(Optional.class)) {
231          MAPPER_LOGGER.trace("No JSON value present for '{}', skipping. JSON is '{}'.", facebookFieldName, json);
232          continue;
233        }
234
235        fieldWithAnnotation.getField().setAccessible(true);
236
237        setJavaFileValue(json, facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings, instance, jsonObject, fieldWithAnnotation, facebookFieldName);
238      }
239
240      // If there are any methods annotated with @JsonMappingCompleted,
241      // invoke them.
242      invokeJsonMappingCompletedMethods(instance);
243
244      return instance;
245    } catch (FacebookJsonMappingException e) {
246      throw e;
247    } catch (Exception e) {
248      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("Unable to map JSON to Java. Offending JSON is '" + json + "'.", e);
249    }
250  }
251
252  private <T> void setJavaFileValue(String json, Set<String> facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings, T instance, JsonObject jsonObject, FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation, String facebookFieldName) throws IllegalAccessException {
253    // Set the Java field's value.
254    //
255    // If we notice that this Facebook field name is mapped more than once,
256    // go into a special mode where we swallow any exceptions that occur
257    // when mapping to the Java field. This is because Facebook will
258    // sometimes return data in different formats for the same field name.
259    // See issues 56 and 90 for examples of this behavior and discussion.
260    try {
261      fieldWithAnnotation.getField().set(instance, toJavaType(fieldWithAnnotation, jsonObject, facebookFieldName));
262    } catch (FacebookJsonMappingException | ParseException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
263      if (facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings.contains(facebookFieldName)) {
264        logMultipleMappingFailedForField(facebookFieldName, fieldWithAnnotation, json);
265      } else {
266        throw e;
267      }
268    }
269  }
270
271  private <T> void handleAbstractFacebookType(String json, T instance) {
272    if (instance instanceof AbstractFacebookType) {
273      ReflectionUtils.setJson(instance, json);
274    }
275  }
276
277  private void checkJsonNotBlank(String json) {
278    if (isBlank(json)) {
279      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("JSON is an empty string - can't map it.");
280    }
281  }
282
283  private void checkJsonNotList(String json) {
284    if (StringJsonUtils.isList(json)) {
285      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("JSON is an array but is being mapped as an object "
286          + "- you should map it as a List instead. Offending JSON is '" + json + "'.");
287    }
288  }
289
290  /**
291   * Finds and invokes methods on {@code object} that are annotated with the {@code @JsonMappingCompleted} annotation.
292   * <p>
293   * This will even work on {@code private} methods.
294   * 
295   * @param object
296   *          The object on which to invoke the method.
297   * @throws IllegalAccessException
298   *           If unable to invoke the method.
299   * @throws InvocationTargetException
300   *           If unable to invoke the method.
301   */
302  protected void invokeJsonMappingCompletedMethods(Object object)
303      throws IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException {
304    for (Method method : findMethodsWithAnnotation(object.getClass(), JsonMappingCompleted.class)) {
305      method.setAccessible(true);
306
307      int methodParameterCount = method.getParameterTypes().length;
308
309      if (methodParameterCount == 0) {
310        method.invoke(object);
311      } else if (methodParameterCount == 1 && JsonMapper.class.equals(method.getParameterTypes()[0])) {
312        method.invoke(object, this);
313      } else {
314        throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(
315          format("Methods annotated with @%s must take 0 parameters or a single %s parameter. Your method was %s",
316            JsonMappingCompleted.class.getSimpleName(), JsonMapper.class.getSimpleName(), method));
317      }
318    }
319  }
320
321  /**
322   * Dumps out a log message when one of a multiple-mapped Facebook field name JSON-to-Java mapping operation fails.
323   * 
324   * @param facebookFieldName
325   *          The Facebook field name.
326   * @param fieldWithAnnotation
327   *          The Java field to map to and its annotation.
328   * @param json
329   *          The JSON that failed to map to the Java field.
330   */
331  protected void logMultipleMappingFailedForField(String facebookFieldName,
332      FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation, String json) {
333    if (!MAPPER_LOGGER.isTraceEnabled()) {
334      return;
335    }
336
337    Field field = fieldWithAnnotation.getField();
338
339    MAPPER_LOGGER.trace(
340      "Could not map '{}' to {}. {}, but continuing on because '{}"
341          + "' is mapped to multiple fields in {}. JSON is {}",
342      facebookFieldName, field.getDeclaringClass().getSimpleName(), field.getName(), facebookFieldName,
343      field.getDeclaringClass().getSimpleName(), json);
344  }
345
346  /**
347   * For a Java field annotated with the {@code Facebook} annotation, figure out what the corresponding Facebook JSON
348   * field name to map to it is.
349   * 
350   * @param fieldWithAnnotation
351   *          A Java field annotated with the {@code Facebook} annotation.
352   * @return The Facebook JSON field name that should be mapped to this Java field.
353   */
354  protected String getFacebookFieldName(FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation) {
355    String facebookFieldName = fieldWithAnnotation.getAnnotation().value();
356    Field field = fieldWithAnnotation.getField();
357
358    // If no Facebook field name was specified in the annotation, assume
359    // it's the same name as the Java field
360    if (isBlank(facebookFieldName)) {
361      MAPPER_LOGGER.trace("No explicit Facebook field name found for {}, so defaulting to the field name itself ({})",
362        field, field.getName());
363
364      facebookFieldName = field.getName();
365    }
366
367    return facebookFieldName;
368  }
369
370  /**
371   * Finds any Facebook JSON fields that are mapped to more than 1 Java field.
372   * 
373   * @param fieldsWithAnnotation
374   *          Java fields annotated with the {@code Facebook} annotation.
375   * @return Any Facebook JSON fields that are mapped to more than 1 Java field.
376   */
377  protected Set<String> facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings(
378      List<FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook>> fieldsWithAnnotation) {
379    Map<String, Integer> facebookFieldsNamesWithOccurrenceCount = new HashMap<>();
380
381    // Get a count of Facebook field name occurrences for each
382    // @Facebook-annotated field
383    fieldsWithAnnotation.forEach(field -> occurrenceCounter(facebookFieldsNamesWithOccurrenceCount, field));
384
385    // Pull out only those field names with multiple mappings
386    Set<String> facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings = facebookFieldsNamesWithOccurrenceCount.entrySet().stream()
387      .filter(entry -> entry.getValue() > 1).map(Entry::getKey).collect(Collectors.toSet());
388
389    return unmodifiableSet(facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings);
390  }
391
392  private void occurrenceCounter(Map<String, Integer> facebookFieldsNamesWithOccurrenceCount, FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> field) {
393    String fieldName = getFacebookFieldName(field);
394    int occurrenceCount = facebookFieldsNamesWithOccurrenceCount.getOrDefault(fieldName, 0);
395    facebookFieldsNamesWithOccurrenceCount.put(fieldName, occurrenceCount + 1);
396  }
397
398  @Override
399  public String toJson(Object object) {
400    return toJson(object, false);
401  }
402
403  @Override
404  public String toJson(Object object, boolean ignoreNullValuedProperties) {
405    JsonValue jsonObj = toJsonInternal(object, ignoreNullValuedProperties);
406    return jsonHelper.getStringFrom(jsonObj);
407  }
408
409  /**
410   * Recursively marshal the given {@code object} to JSON.
411   * <p>
412   * Used by {@link #toJson(Object)}.
413   * 
414   * @param object
415   *          The object to marshal.
416   * @param ignoreNullValuedProperties
417   *          If this is {@code true}, no Javabean properties with {@code null} values will be included in the generated
418   *          JSON.
419   * @return JSON representation of the given {@code object}.
420   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
421   *           If an error occurs while marshaling to JSON.
422   */
423  protected JsonValue toJsonInternal(Object object, boolean ignoreNullValuedProperties) {
424    if (object == null) {
425      return Json.NULL;
426    }
427
428    if (object instanceof JsonValue) {
429      return (JsonValue) object;
430    }
431
432    if (object instanceof List<?>) {
433      return convertListToJsonArray((List<?>) object, ignoreNullValuedProperties);
434    }
435
436    if (object instanceof Map<?, ?>) {
437      return convertMapToJsonObject(object, ignoreNullValuedProperties);
438    }
439
440    if (isPrimitive(object)) {
441      return javaTypeToJsonValue(object);
442    }
443
444    if (object instanceof Optional) {
445      return convertOptionalToJsonValue((Optional) object, ignoreNullValuedProperties);
446    }
447
448    if (object instanceof BigInteger) {
449      return Json.value(((BigInteger) object).longValue());
450    }
451
452    if (object instanceof BigDecimal) {
453      return Json.value(((BigDecimal) object).doubleValue());
454    }
455
456    if (object instanceof Enum) {
457      return Json.value(((Enum) object).name());
458    }
459
460    if (object instanceof Date) {
461      return Json.value(DateUtils.toLongFormatFromDate((Date) object));
462    }
463
464    // We've passed the special-case bits, so let's try to marshal this as a
465    // plain old Javabean...
466
467    List<FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook>> fieldsWithAnnotation =
468        findFieldsWithAnnotation(object.getClass(), Facebook.class);
469
470    JsonObject jsonObject = new JsonObject();
471
472    // No longer throw an exception in this case. If there are multiple fields
473    // with the same @Facebook value, it's luck of the draw which is picked for
474    // JSON marshaling.
475    // TODO: A better implementation would query each duplicate-mapped field. If
476    // it has is a non-null value and the other duplicate values are null, use
477    // the non-null field.
478    Set<String> facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings = facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings(fieldsWithAnnotation);
479    if (!facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings.isEmpty() && MAPPER_LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
480      MAPPER_LOGGER.debug(
481        "Unable to convert to JSON because multiple @{} annotations for the same name are present: {}",
482        Facebook.class.getSimpleName(), facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings);
483    }
484
485    for (FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation : fieldsWithAnnotation) {
486      String facebookFieldName = getFacebookFieldName(fieldWithAnnotation);
487      fieldWithAnnotation.getField().setAccessible(true);
488
489      try {
490        Object fieldValue = fieldWithAnnotation.getField().get(object);
491
492        if (fieldValue instanceof Connection) {
493          continue;
494        }
495
496        if (!(ignoreNullValuedProperties
497            && (fieldValue == null || isEmptyOptional(fieldValue) || isEmptyCollectionOrMap(fieldValue)))) {
498          jsonObject.add(facebookFieldName, toJsonInternal(fieldValue, ignoreNullValuedProperties));
499        }
500      } catch (Exception e) {
501        throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(
502          "Unable to process field '" + facebookFieldName + "' for " + object.getClass(), e);
503      }
504    }
505
506    return jsonObject;
507  }
508
509  private boolean isEmptyOptional(Object fieldValue) {
510    return fieldValue instanceof Optional && !((Optional) fieldValue).isPresent();
511  }
512
513  private JsonArray convertListToJsonArray(List<?> objects, boolean ignoreNullValuedProperties) {
514    JsonArray jsonArray = new JsonArray();
515    objects.stream().map(o -> toJsonInternal(o, ignoreNullValuedProperties)).forEach(jsonArray::add);
516    return jsonArray;
517  }
518
519  private JsonObject convertMapToJsonObject(Object object, boolean ignoreNullValuedProperties) {
520    JsonObject jsonObject = new JsonObject();
521    for (Entry<?, ?> entry : ((Map<?, ?>) object).entrySet()) {
522      if (!(entry.getKey() instanceof String)) {
523        throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("Your Map keys must be of type " + String.class
524            + " in order to be converted to JSON.  Offending map is " + object);
525      }
526
527      try {
528        jsonObject.add((String) entry.getKey(), toJsonInternal(entry.getValue(), ignoreNullValuedProperties));
529      } catch (ParseException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
530        throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(
531          "Unable to process value '" + entry.getValue() + "' for key '" + entry.getKey() + "' in Map " + object, e);
532      }
533    }
534    return jsonObject;
535  }
536
537  private JsonValue convertOptionalToJsonValue(Optional<?> object, boolean ignoreNullValuedProperties) {
538    return toJsonInternal(object.orElse(null), ignoreNullValuedProperties);
539  }
540
541  /**
542   * Given a {@code json} value of something like {@code MyValue} or {@code 123} , return a representation of that value
543   * of type {@code type}.
544   * <p>
545   * This is to support non-legal JSON served up by Facebook for API calls like {@code Friends.get} (example result:
546   * {@code [222333,1240079]}).
547   * 
548   * @param <T>
549   *          The Java type to map to.
550   * @param json
551   *          The non-legal JSON to map to the Java type.
552   * @param type
553   *          Type token.
554   * @return Java representation of {@code json}.
555   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
556   *           If an error occurs while mapping JSON to Java.
557   */
558  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
559  protected <T> T toPrimitiveJavaType(String json, Class<T> type) {
560
561    json = jsonHelper.cleanString(json);
562
563    if (typeIsString(type)) {
564      return (T) json;
565    }
566    if (typeIsInteger(type)) {
567      return (T) Integer.valueOf(json);
568    }
569    if (typeIsBoolean(type)) {
570      return (T) Boolean.valueOf(json);
571    }
572    if (typeIsLong(type)) {
573      return (T) Long.valueOf(json);
574    }
575    if (typeIsDouble(type)) {
576      return (T) Double.valueOf(json);
577    }
578    if (typeIsFloat(type)) {
579      return (T) Float.valueOf(json);
580    }
581    if (typeIsBigInteger(type)) {
582      return (T) new BigInteger(json);
583    }
584    if (typeIsBigDecimal(type)) {
585      return (T) new BigDecimal(json);
586    }
587
588    throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("Don't know how to map JSON to " + type
589        + ". Are you sure you're mapping to the right class?\nOffending JSON is '" + json + "'.");
590  }
591
592  /**
593   * Extracts JSON data for a field according to its {@code Facebook} annotation and returns it converted to the proper
594   * Java type.
595   * 
596   * @param fieldWithAnnotation
597   *          The field/annotation pair which specifies what Java type to convert to.
598   * @param jsonObject
599   *          "Raw" JSON object to pull data from.
600   * @param facebookFieldName
601   *          Specifies what JSON field to pull "raw" data from.
602   * @return A
603   * @throws ParseException
604   *           If an error occurs while mapping JSON to Java.
605   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
606   *           If an error occurs while mapping JSON to Java.
607   */
608  protected Object toJavaType(FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation, JsonObject jsonObject,
609      String facebookFieldName) {
610    Class<?> type = fieldWithAnnotation.getField().getType();
611    JsonValue rawValue = jsonObject.get(facebookFieldName);
612
613    // Short-circuit right off the bat if we've got a null value, but Optionals are created nevertheless.
614    if (jsonHelper.isNull(rawValue)) {
615      if (typeIsOptional(type)) {
616        return Optional.empty();
617      }
618      return null;
619    }
620
621    if (typeIsString(type)) {
622      /*
623       * Special handling here for better error checking.
624       *
625       * Since {@code JsonObject.getString()} will return literal JSON text even if it's _not_ a JSON string, we check
626       * the marshaled type and bail if needed. For example, calling {@code JsonObject.getString("results")} on the
627       * below JSON...
628       *
629       * <code> { "results":[ {"name":"Mark Allen"} ] } </code>
630       *
631       * ... would return the string {@code "[{"name":"Mark Allen"}]"} instead of throwing an error. So we throw the
632       * error ourselves.
633       *
634       * Per Antonello Naccarato, sometimes FB will return an empty JSON array instead of an empty string. Look for that
635       * here.
636       */
637      if (jsonHelper.isEmptyArray(rawValue)) {
638        MAPPER_LOGGER.trace("Coercing an empty JSON array to an empty string for {}", fieldWithAnnotation);
639
640        return "";
641      }
642
643      /*
644       * If the user wants a string, _always_ give her a string.
645       *
646       * This is useful if, for example, you've got a @Facebook-annotated string field that you'd like to have a numeric
647       * type shoved into.
648       *
649       * User beware: this will turn *anything* into a string, which might lead to results you don't expect.
650       */
651      return jsonHelper.getStringFrom(rawValue);
652    }
653
654    if (typeIsInteger(type)) {
655      return jsonHelper.getIntegerFrom(rawValue);
656    }
657    if (typeIsBoolean(type)) {
658      return jsonHelper.getBooleanFrom(rawValue);
659    }
660    if (typeIsLong(type)) {
661      return jsonHelper.getLongFrom(rawValue);
662    }
663    if (typeIsDouble(type)) {
664      return jsonHelper.getDoubleFrom(rawValue);
665    }
666    if (typeIsFloat(type)) {
667      return jsonHelper.getFloatFrom(rawValue);
668    }
669    if (typeIsBigInteger(type)) {
670      return jsonHelper.getBigIntegerFrom(rawValue);
671    }
672    if (typeIsBigDecimal(type)) {
673      return jsonHelper.getBigDecimalFrom(rawValue);
674    }
675    if (typeIsList(type)) {
676      return toJavaList(rawValue.toString(), getFirstParameterizedTypeArgument(fieldWithAnnotation.getField()));
677    }
678    if (typeIsMap(type)) {
679      return convertRawValueToMap(rawValue.toString(), fieldWithAnnotation.getField());
680    }
681
682    if (typeIsOptional(type)) {
683      return Optional.ofNullable(
684        toJavaObject(rawValue.toString(), getFirstParameterizedTypeArgument(fieldWithAnnotation.getField())));
685    }
686
687    if (type.isEnum()) {
688      Optional<Enum> enumTypeOpt = convertRawValueToEnumType(type, rawValue);
689      if (enumTypeOpt.isPresent()) {
690        return enumTypeOpt.get();
691      }
692    }
693
694    if (typeIsDate(type)) {
695      return DateUtils.toDateFromLongFormat(jsonHelper.getStringFrom(rawValue));
696    }
697
698    if (Connection.class.equals(type)) {
699      Optional<Connection> createdConnectionOpt = convertRawValueToConnection(fieldWithAnnotation, rawValue);
700      if (createdConnectionOpt.isPresent()) {
701        return createdConnectionOpt.get();
702      }
703    }
704
705    String rawValueAsString = jsonHelper.getStringFrom(rawValue);
706
707    // Hack for issue #76 where FB will sometimes return a Post's Comments as
708    // "[]" instead of an object type (wtf)F
709    if (Comments.class.isAssignableFrom(type) && rawValue instanceof JsonArray) {
710      MAPPER_LOGGER.debug(
711        "Encountered comment array '{}' but expected a {} object instead.  Working around that by coercing "
712            + "into an empty {} instance...",
713        rawValueAsString, Comments.class.getSimpleName(), Comments.class.getSimpleName());
714
715      JsonObject workaroundJsonObject = new JsonObject();
716      workaroundJsonObject.add("total_count", 0);
717      workaroundJsonObject.add("data", new JsonArray());
718      rawValueAsString = workaroundJsonObject.toString();
719    }
720
721    // Some other type - recurse into it
722    return toJavaObject(rawValueAsString, type);
723  }
724
725  private Optional<Connection> convertRawValueToConnection(FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation,
726      JsonValue rawValue) {
727    if (null != facebookClient) {
728      return Optional.of(new Connection(facebookClient, jsonHelper.getStringFrom(rawValue),
729        getFirstParameterizedTypeArgument(fieldWithAnnotation.getField())));
730    } else {
731      MAPPER_LOGGER.warn(
732        "Skipping java field {}, because it has the type Connection, but the given facebook client is null",
733        fieldWithAnnotation.getField().getName());
734    }
735    return Optional.empty();
736  }
737
738  private Optional<Enum> convertRawValueToEnumType(Class<?> type, JsonValue rawValue) {
739    Class<? extends Enum> enumType = type.asSubclass(Enum.class);
740    try {
741      return Optional.of(Enum.valueOf(enumType, rawValue.asString()));
742    } catch (IllegalArgumentException iae) {
743      MAPPER_LOGGER.debug("Cannot map string {} to enum {}, try fallback toUpperString next...", rawValue.asString(),
744        enumType.getName());
745    }
746    try {
747      return Optional.of(Enum.valueOf(enumType, rawValue.asString().toUpperCase()));
748    } catch (IllegalArgumentException iae) {
749      MAPPER_LOGGER.debug("Mapping string {} to enum {} not possible", rawValue.asString(), enumType.getName());
750    }
751    return Optional.empty();
752  }
753
754  private Map convertRawValueToMap(String json, Field field) {
755    Class<?> firstParam = getFirstParameterizedTypeArgument(field);
756    if (!typeIsString(firstParam)) {
757      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("The java type map needs to have a 'String' key, but is " + firstParam);
758    }
759
760    Class<?> secondParam = getSecondParameterizedTypeArgument(field);
761
762    if (StringJsonUtils.isObject(json)) {
763      JsonObject jsonObject = Json.parse(json).asObject();
764      Map<String, Object> map = new HashMap<>();
765      for (String key : jsonObject.names()) {
766        String value = jsonHelper.getStringFrom(jsonObject.get(key));
767        map.put(key, toJavaObject(value, secondParam));
768      }
769      return map;
770    }
771
772    return null;
773  }
774
775  private JsonValue javaTypeToJsonValue(Object object) {
776    if (object == null) {
777      return Json.NULL;
778    }
779
780    Class<?> type = object.getClass();
781
782    if (typeIsString(type)) {
783      return Json.value((String) object);
784    }
785
786    if (typeIsInteger(type)) {
787      return Json.value((Integer) object);
788    }
789
790    if (typeIsBoolean(type)) {
791      return Json.value((Boolean) object);
792    }
793
794    if (typeIsLong(type)) {
795      return Json.value((Long) object);
796    }
797
798    if (typeIsDouble(type)) {
799      return Json.value((Double) object);
800    }
801
802    if (typeIsFloat(type)) {
803      return Json.value((Float) object);
804    }
805
806    if (typeIsByte(type)) {
807      return Json.value((Byte) object);
808    }
809
810    if (typeIsShort(type)) {
811      return Json.value((Short) object);
812    }
813
814    if (typeIsCharacter(type)) {
815      return Json.value(Character.toString((Character) object));
816    }
817
818    return Json.NULL;
819
820  }
821
822  private boolean typeIsCharacter(Class<?> type) {
823    return Character.class.equals(type) || Character.TYPE.equals(type);
824  }
825
826  private boolean typeIsShort(Class<?> type) {
827    return Short.class.equals(type) || Short.TYPE.equals(type);
828  }
829
830  private boolean typeIsByte(Class<?> type) {
831    return Byte.class.equals(type) || Byte.TYPE.equals(type);
832  }
833
834  private boolean typeIsFloat(Class<?> type) {
835    return Float.class.equals(type) || Float.TYPE.equals(type);
836  }
837
838  private boolean typeIsLong(Class<?> type) {
839    return Long.class.equals(type) || Long.TYPE.equals(type);
840  }
841
842  private boolean typeIsInteger(Class<?> type) {
843    return Integer.class.equals(type) || Integer.TYPE.equals(type);
844  }
845
846  private boolean typeIsBigDecimal(Class<?> type) {
847    return BigDecimal.class.equals(type);
848  }
849
850  private boolean typeIsBigInteger(Class<?> type) {
851    return BigInteger.class.equals(type);
852  }
853
854  private boolean typeIsDouble(Class<?> type) {
855    return Double.class.equals(type) || Double.TYPE.equals(type);
856  }
857
858  private boolean typeIsBoolean(Class<?> type) {
859    return Boolean.class.equals(type) || Boolean.TYPE.equals(type);
860  }
861
862  private boolean typeIsString(Class<?> type) {
863    return String.class.equals(type);
864  }
865
866  private boolean typeIsOptional(Class<?> type) {
867    return Optional.class.equals(type);
868  }
869
870  private boolean typeIsMap(Class<?> type) {
871    return Map.class.equals(type);
872  }
873
874  private boolean typeIsList(Class<?> type) {
875    return List.class.equals(type);
876  }
877
878  private boolean typeIsDate(Class<?> type) {
879    return Date.class.equals(type);
880  }
881}
